exam.question: Many people lost their jobs during the business _________.

answer.explain: business depression： 商业萧条。 句意： 许多人在商业萧条时丢了工作。 desperation： 绝望； decrease： 减少； despair： 失望， 令人失望的人(或事)。

sentences.sContent: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.sCn: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

sentences.sContent: ...They were less likely to report symptoms of depression than those in the other facilities...
...crying is more commonly associated with minor forms of depression than with major depression involving suicidal thoughts...
...How long would it be before I sank into ill health and depression again...
...leading to better health and less chance of depression later in life...

synos.tran: 沮丧；[地理]洼地；[经]不景气；忧愁

phrases.pCn: 大萧条（美国经济大萧条时期）

words.tran: 使沮丧；使萧条（depress的过去式和过去分词形式）；压低

trans.tranCn: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
trans.tranOther: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs
